item.title: Hack The Box Write-up - SolidState
item.description: This is my second writeup for a machine from Hack The Box. It is again a rather easy one but still lots of fun. Lots of opportunities to do some oldschool telnet work on email servers. It starts with port scanning and illustrates the importance of scanning also more unpopular ports. After finding the email server with default credentials, you must use your administrator power to get code execution. Once on the box, all you have to do is finding an insecure cron job and you are root.

item.title: Hack The Box Write-up - Calamity
item.description: Hack The Box is a new company offering lab servers you can test penetration testing techniques on. It is quite educative and a lot of fun. They have multiple machines and all follow a similar pattern. You start with an IP address, have to find a way to get code execution on the machine (usually as an unprivileged user) and have to escalate from there to root. This post is about one of the machines called calamity.

item.title: About
item.description: About Me I’.m the guy who made this website. I am a big fan of tautologies too. And I did not really make this website alone. Many thanks to: The creators of Hugo for the generator building this site: https://gohugo.io/ The creator of After Dark for the theme that it is based on: https://comfusion.github.io/after-dark/ .blur-up { -webkit-filter: blur(5px); filter: blur(5px); transition: filter 400ms, -webkit-filter 400ms; } .
